The definiton of personal data

Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ('data subject'); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person;
What type of personal data do we process?

We process those of your personal data that we receive in the course our business relationship with you. The types of personal data we process can include your name, address, contact details, e-mail address, your ID data. In addition, this may include order data (e.g. payment orders), sales data, advertising data, and data for the fulfilment of our legal obligations. These data are either obtained directly from you or provided to us by third parties, such as our partner companies.

data: How long is your data stored?

We will store your data only for as long as necessary for the purpose of which the data was collected. In any case, we will store your data for as long as we are obliged to do so by law (legal retention times) or if periods of limitation for potential legal claims have not yet expired.
Cookies on the Remootio website

Cookies are files with a small amount of data that are commonly used as anonymous unique identifiers. These are sent to your browser from the websites that you visit and are stored on your device's internal memory. We use cookies to improve the user experiece of our website's visitor. No data stored in cookies can be associated with the visitor, as these data are pseudonymized. During this process the website might store your language setting of the website, and auto-fill data to input forms into cookies. The website might also store data in cookies regarding how often and which parts of our website you use. You have the option to either accept or refuse these cookies and know when a cookie is being sent to your device. If you choose to refuse our cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of the website.
Your rights regarding the data processing
You are entitled to all the rights decribed in the applicable law ("GDPR"). These are the following:
You have the right to know whether and which personal data we are processing and you have the right to receive copies of these data
You are entitled to require deletion or correction of the personal data that is processed not in conformity with the law
You have the right to disagree with the processing of personal data and to make a complaint to a data protection supervisory authority within the EU.
You are entitled to require us to limit processing your data to only those activities that are necessary for fullfilling our legal requirements
You are entitled to require data portability and be informed about the third parties to whom personal data are disclosed.
